intro: Erodium laciniatum f. involucratum, commonly known as the velvetleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing herb with finely divided, ovate leaves that are covered in a dense layer of soft, silky hairs. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in gardens, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the Geraniaceae family.
